comments.content: I just created 2 and it works, so I think as many as needed

discussion.content:
Correct Answer is D. 
1, which is used for all application modules

choices.A: 3, one for an application's user modules, one for an application's administrator modules, and one for the ServiceNow administrator's modules
choices.C: 2, one for an application's user modules and one for an application's administrator modules
choices.D: 1, which is used for all application modules
choices.B: As many as the application design requires

discussion.content: C is correct. git stash - temporarily shelves (or stashes) changes you've made to your working copy so you can work on something else, and the come back and re-apply them later on

Selected Answer: C
Stash is correct

Selected Answer: C
Stash is correct SN CAD ebook pg102

Selected Answer: C
https://developer.servicenow.com/dev.do#!/learn/learning-plans/utah/new_to_servicenow/app_store_learnv2_devenvironment_utah_stashing_changes

Selected Answer: D
Update Set is the source control operation used to store local changes on an instance for later application.
Brance is actually used to isolating new feautures, bugs, or experiment. To work on your independent changes without directly affecting the actual codebase

I am leaning more towards stashing.
"Stashing in source control saves local changes for an application to apply later. The local changes do not need to be committed to the remote repository. Stashing a change removes the change from the current application and saves the change for a developer to later apply or delete." https://developer.servicenow.com/dev.do#!/learn/learning-plans/utah/new_to_servicenow/app_store_learnv2_devenvironment_utah_stashing_changes#:~:text=To%20stash%20something%20is%20to%20store%20that%20something,for%20a%20developer%20to%20later%20apply%20or%20delete.
i think the answer shoud be A
